title: Dexter Daniels (American football)
text:
Dexter Lavista Daniels (December 8, 1973) is an American former college and professional <a href="American%20football">football</a> player who was a <a href="linebacker">linebacker</a> in the <a href="National%20Football%20League">National Football League</a> (NFL) for a single season in . Daniels played <a href="college%20football">college football</a> for the <a href="University%20of%20Florida">University of Florida</a>, and thereafter, he played professionally for the <a href="Baltimore%20Ravens">Baltimore Ravens</a> of the NFL.
Early years.
Daniels was born in <a href="Valdosta%2C%20Georgia">Valdosta, Georgia</a> in 1973. He attended <a href="Valdosta%20High%20School">Valdosta High School</a>, where he played high school football for the Valdosta Wildcats and was named "<a href="USA%20Today">USA Today</a>" Defensive High School Player of the Year in 1991.
College career.
Daniels accepted an athletic scholarship to attend the <a href="University%20of%20Florida">University of Florida</a> in Gainesville, Florida, and he played for the <a href="Florida%20Gators%20football">Florida Gators football</a> team under coach <a href="Steve%20Spurrier">Steve Spurrier</a> from <a href="1992%20Florida%20Gators%20football%20team">1992</a> to <a href="1995%20Florida%20Gators%20football%20team">1995</a>. The Gators won <a href="Southeastern%20Conference">Southeastern Conference</a> (SEC) championships in <a href="1993%20Florida%20Gators%20football%20team">1993</a> and <a href="1994%20Florida%20Gators%20football%20team">1994</a>, and finished the 1995 regular season as the 12–0 SEC champions, but were ultimately defeated 62–24 by the <a href="Nebraska%20Cornhuskers%20football">Nebraska Cornhuskers</a> in the <a href="Fiesta%20Bowl">Fiesta Bowl</a> for the <a href="Bowl%20Alliance">Bowl Alliance</a> national championship. Daniels was a first-team All-SEC selection after his senior season in 1995.
Daniels graduated from the University of Florida with a bachelor's degree in criminal justice in 1997.
Professional career.
The <a href="Baltimore%20Ravens">Baltimore Ravens</a> selected Daniels in the sixth round (172nd pick overall) of the <a href="1996%20NFL%20Draft">1996 NFL Draft</a>, and he played in four games for the Ravens during their inaugural season in Baltimore.
